content.question: Show all your work. Indicate clearly the methods you use, because you will be scored on the correctness of your methods as well as on the accuracy and completeness of your results and explanations.Past records from a certain movie theater indicate that <math alttext="80" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>80</mn></mrow></mstyle></math> percent of moviegoers make a purchase at the movie theater’s snack bar. A random sample of <math alttext="3" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>3</mn></mrow></mstyle></math> moviegoers from the theater will be selected at random. Let the random variable <math alttext="uppercase S" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>S</mi></mrow></mstyle></math> represent the number of moviegoers who make a purchase at the snack bar from the <math alttext="3" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>3</mn></mrow></mstyle></math> selected.(a) Complete the following table to create the probability distribution of <math alttext="uppercase S" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>S</mi></mrow></mstyle></math>.<math alttext="lowercase s" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>s</mi></mrow></mstyle></math> <math alttext="0" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>0</mn></mrow></mstyle></math> <math alttext="1" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>1</mn></mrow></mstyle></math> <math alttext="2" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></mstyle></math> <math alttext="3" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>3</mn></mrow></mstyle></math> <math alttext="P of, lowercase s" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>P</mi><mo>(</mo><mi>s</mi><mo>)</mo></mrow></mstyle></math> <math alttext="0.008" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>0.008</mn></mrow></mstyle></math><math alttext="0.512" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>0.512</mn></mrow></mstyle></math>(b) Calculate and interpret the expected value of <math alttext="uppercase S" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>S</mi></mrow></mstyle></math>.

frqParts.text: Show all your work. Indicate clearly the methods you use, because you will be scored on the correctness of your methods as well as on the accuracy and completeness of your results and explanations.Past records from a certain movie theater indicate that <math alttext="80" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>80</mn></mrow></mstyle></math> percent of moviegoers make a purchase at the movie theater’s snack bar. A random sample of <math alttext="3" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>3</mn></mrow></mstyle></math> moviegoers from the theater will be selected at random. Let the random variable <math alttext="uppercase S" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>S</mi></mrow></mstyle></math> represent the number of moviegoers who make a purchase at the snack bar from the <math alttext="3" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>3</mn></mrow></mstyle></math> selected.(a) Complete the following table to create the probability distribution of <math alttext="uppercase S" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>S</mi></mrow></mstyle></math>.<math alttext="lowercase s" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>s</mi></mrow></mstyle></math> <math alttext="0" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>0</mn></mrow></mstyle></math> <math alttext="1" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>1</mn></mrow></mstyle></math> <math alttext="2" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></mstyle></math> <math alttext="3" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>3</mn></mrow></mstyle></math> <math alttext="P of, lowercase s" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>P</mi><mo>(</mo><mi>s</mi><mo>)</mo></mrow></mstyle></math> <math alttext="0.008" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>0.008</mn></mrow></mstyle></math><math alttext="0.512" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>0.512</mn></mrow></mstyle></math>(b) Calculate and interpret the expected value of <math alttext="uppercase S" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>S</mi></mrow></mstyle></math>.

unit.text: 4: Probability, Random Variables, and Probability Distributions

topic.text: 4.7: Introduction to Random Variables and Probability Distributions

skill.text: Skill 2.B: Construct numerical or graphical representations of distributions.
